bibl.title: Letter from S. W. Welch to Henry Rose Carter, September 19, 1923

div1.p: Welch invites Carter to speak on the early history of malaria in the western hemisphere at the annual meeting of the National Malaria Committee in Washington, D.C.

div1.head: Letter from S. W. Welch to Henry Rose Carter, September 19, 1923
div1.opener:
HERE WE REST
STATE OF ALABAMA
ALABAMA STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
519 DEXTER AVENUE
MONTGOMERY
BUREAUS
VITAL STATISTICS
HYGIENIC LABORATORY
ENGINEERING
COUNTY ORGANIZATION
VENEREAL DISEASE CONTROL
CHILD HYGIENE AND PUBLIC
HEALTH NURSING
EPIDEMIOLOGY
INSPECTION
PUBLICITY, EDUCATION AND
PRINTING
TUBERCULOSIS CONTROL
September 19, 1923.
Asst. Surgeon General,
H. R. Carter,
Badin Hospital,
Badin, N.C.
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Our annual meeting of the National Malaria
Committee will be held in Washington, November 12-15th.
It is my privilege to invite you to give a short address
at the opening of the meeting on any subject which suits
you.

Assuming that you are the author of the edi-
torial which recently appeared in the Southern Medical
Journal on “The Origin of Malaria in the Americas”, it has
been suggested that you discuss the “Early History of Malaria
in the Western Hemisphere”.

I realize that you do not wish to assume any
additional burdens and that you must conserve your efforts
for only the most important things. However, our program
will not be complete without a word from you and I am hoping
that you will feel strong enough to be present and give an
extemporaneous talk without burdening yourself in its pre-
paration.

With high personal regard and best wishes
for your speedy recovery, I am,
div1.closer:
Respectfully yours, S. W. Welch S. W. Welch,
State Health Officer,
Chairman National Malaria Committee.
